snippet: The 18th-century Saxon court jeweler Johann Christian Neuber fashioned natural treasures like semiprecious stones and gold into artistic bonbons, on view in “Gold, Jasper and Carnelian,” at the Frick.
abstract: Roberta Smith reviews exhibit Gold, Jasper and Carnelian: Johann Christian Neuber at the Saxon Court, featuring objects by 18th-century German goldsmith Johann Christian Neuber, at the Frick Collection.
lead_paragraph: The 18th-century Saxon court jeweler Johann Christian Neuber fashioned natural treasures like semiprecious stones and gold into artistic bonbons, on view in “Gold, Jasper and Carnelian,” at the Frick.
